meanings.definition: The mental faculty by which one deliberately chooses or decides upon a course of action.
meanings.sent1: Her strong wills helped her achieve her goals.
meanings.sent2: His wills guided him to make the right decision.
meanings.sent3: The stubborn cat's wills to catch the mouse were relentless.
meanings.sent4: The wills of the wind determined the direction of the kite.
meanings.sent5: The wills of the determined student were as unyielding as a rock.

meanings.definition: The legal document in which a person specifies how their property is to be distributed after their death.
meanings.sent1: She left a detailed wills for her family to follow.
meanings.sent2: The lawyer reviewed the wills to ensure it was valid.
meanings.sent3: The wills of the deceased surprised everyone with its contents.
meanings.sent4: The wills of the ancestors shaped the family's future.
meanings.sent5: The wills of the rich man caused disputes among his heirs.

meanings.definition: The desire or inclination to do something.
meanings.sent1: His wills to succeed were evident in his hard work.
meanings.sent2: The child's wills to play outside were strong.
meanings.sent3: The wills to eat ice cream on a cold day seemed odd.
meanings.sent4: Her wills to travel the world knew no bounds.
meanings.sent5: The wills to explore the unknown drove the adventurer forward.
